function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inherent tension between mechanistic, reductive scientific paradigms in green building design and emerging regenerative development approaches may impact the effectiveness of disease mitigation strategies in built environments.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of compelling evidence for significant global ghg emissions reductions within the coming decade","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Compromise of addressing climate change due to other societal and political priorities","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Slow assimilation of green building strategies within existing design context","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Insufficient mitigation progress in building practices","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on day-to-day actions for adaptation to climate change","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of a holistic approach in regenerative development and design","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for lack of mainstream adoption of regenerative development and design","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Influence of as yet unknown factors on societal actions","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 on community behaviors and values","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sars-cov-2 virus transmission in built environments","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Infectious phase of sars-cov-2 before symptoms appear","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerability of entire human population to sars-cov-2 infection","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to distinguish the effectiveness of non-pharmaceutical interventions npis on sars-cov-2 transmission and covid-19 dynamics","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Difficulty in disentangling the impact of individual npis due to non-random allocation and dependency on the state of the epidemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential confusion bias in effect estimation due to differences in behavior and adherence levels across various populations","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Sparse and noisy data for estimating transmission rates","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Unknown parametric form of transmission rates","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Association of npis with epidemic dynamics has never been formally studied using french data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Open data on the french covid-19 epidemic may pose a risk of unauthorized access and misuse.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relying on a government database for hospitalization data introduces a risk of data accuracy and integrity issues.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of dynamic modeling and population-based kalman filter approach introduces a risk of model complexity and interpretation challenges.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Hospitalized patients with biologically confirmed diagnosis of covid-19 or suggestive ct scan","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Standardizing hospitalization data using population size","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Non-pharmaceutical interventions implemented during the epidemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Multifaceted public health interventions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Closure of schools, bars, and restaurants","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Non-consideration of travel bans and enhanced testing","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited restrictions on personal outings and on-site work during certain periods may contribute to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inconsistent school closures and reopenings could lead to the spread of contagious diseases among students and staff.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Phased reopening of non-essential stores, bars, and restaurants may contribute to increased social interaction and transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Enforced curfews may lead to non-compliance and subsequent increase in gatherings during non-curfew hours, leading to higher transmission of contagious disease.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Controversy over the role of weather conditions in sars-cov-2 transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on seasonal trends in temperature and humidity for virus transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Normalized iptcc index as a measure of transmission conditions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmissible diseases such as sars-cov-2 variants of concern vocs may affect transmission rates and public health interventions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Seasonal variations in weather may impact the transmission of contagious diseases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential exponential growth of voc from 0% to 46% nationally in a short timeframe","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited data for the bourgogne-franche-comté region on january 27, 2021","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Increase in vaccination coverage to approximately 12% by the end of the study period","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex modeling of disease dynamics","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear vaccine coverage and transmission rate","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Model measurement errors","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complex mathematical modeling of disease transmission and estimation procedures.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The potential spread of contagious diseases due to multiple data series in multiple regions being observed together","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assumption of randomly distributed initial uncertainty variables with unknown covariance","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Treating the population intercept as an empirical mean over the population members","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Coupling of dynamics across regions in the population-based estimate","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of prior knowledge to force variables in the population to be constant","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Correction of errors in initial conditions over time","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"}]}
